text:
I am White, a color that embodies purity and simplicity, yet I find myself tangled in the complexities of society. In a world bursting with vibrant hues, I often feel overshadowed, a blank canvas amidst the chaos of color. People see me as a symbol of peace, a fresh start, but they also associate me with sterility and coldness. 

In gatherings, I am the backdrop, the tablecloth that holds the feast, the walls that cradle laughter. I am the wedding dress, the symbol of new beginnings, yet I am also the color of mourning, a paradox that leaves me feeling both cherished and overlooked. I float between celebrations and solemn moments, a silent observer of lifeâ€™s dualities.

Children adore me, their fingers smudging me with crayons, transforming my blankness into their wild imaginations. Adults, however, often see me as a challenge, a color that demands maintenance and care. I am the pristine car that gleams under the sun, yet I am also the one that shows every speck of dirt, every imperfection.

In this society, I am both revered and reviled. I am the canvas for dreams, yet I am also the reminder of fragility. I exist in the spaces between, a quiet presence that reflects the world around me. I am White, a color that seeks to find its place, navigating the spectrum of human experience, forever balancing between the light and the shadows.
